title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
sburjan` - (00:00): automata, parsers, grammars, etc sdumitriu - (00:01): No, anything works sdumitriu - (00:01): Quercus says that it can run wordpress sdumitriu - (00:01): And that's complex sburjan` - (00:01): so this means there translation libs are pretty complex on the inside sdumitriu - (00:01): Yes sdumitriu - (00:02): PHP the language is simple sdumitriu - (00:02): Actually any language is simple sburjan` - (00:02): yes, wp is pretty complex .. but not the most complex php app I've seen .. Joomla is much more complex that wp sdumitriu - (00:02): What makes it complex is the utilities sdumitriu - (00:02): All the PHP libs, all the standard JDK classes, all the standard C libraries sburjan` - (00:02): let's not add FB. I'm still wondering how they can use PHP at such complexity fmancinelli joined #xwiki at 00:20 rrodriguez\_ left at 00:43 (Quit: rrodriguez\_ florinciu left at 01:02 (Read error: Connection reset by peer fmancinelli left at 01:26 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 02:01 flaviusolaru left at 02:16 (Quit: Leaving. asrfel left at 02:25 (Quit: Leaving. cjdelisle - (03:49): "Actually any language is simple"  C++? ;) sdumitriu - (03:52): I meant about compiling sdumitriu - (03:52): Compiling C++ is not that hard sdumitriu - (03:53): The hard part is compiling it into something performant cjdelisle - (03:53): well when you compare it that way, you're definitely right. sburjan` left at 03:59 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds venkatesh joined #xwiki at 04:57 abusenius left at 05:10 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds baurjan joined #xwiki at 05:14 baurjan - (05:14): hello baurjan - (05:14): anybody is here? cjdelisle - (05:15): yu[ cjdelisle - (05:15): p baurjan - (05:15): cool baurjan - (05:15): are you free to help me? cjdelisle - (05:15): Depends on how much help you need ;)  what's your question? baurjan - (05:16): if I want to make a whole new template or skin for xwiki, from what should i start? cjdelisle - (05:16): How much different does it need to be from the regular type? cjdelisle - (05:17): Are you just changing a couple things, or a whole new look? baurjan - (05:17): background color, background images baurjan - (05:17): and some layout cjdelisle - (05:18): Are you using the .exe file, the .zip file or the .war file for your wiki? baurjan - (05:18): exe cjdelisle - (05:19): That should have installed the wiki somewhere on your hard disk, there should be a webapps folder somewhere. baurjan - (05:19): yup baurjan - (05:19): i know where it is cjdelisle - (05:20): In that folder you should fine webapps\xwiki\templates baurjan - (05:20): ok cjdelisle - (05:20): Inside of the templates folder is all of the layout templates which defines the interface. baurjan - (05:21): ok baurjan - (05:21): one more question cjdelisle - (05:21): When you are at yourwiki.com/bin/view/Some/Page, you are looking at the view.vm template. baurjan - (05:21): when i create a blog news, there is a date attached to the blog cjdelisle - (05:21): /bin/view/  --> view.vm   /bin/edit/   --> edit.vm    make sense? baurjan - (05:22): how can I change the view of that date baurjan - (05:22): yup cjdelisle - (05:22): The blog is an application inside of the wiki (it's Documents in the database) baurjan - (05:23): when I open the source code of the html page, i can see the css class caled blogDay baurjan - (05:23): day baurjan - (05:23): i tried to find that css class baurjan - (05:23): file baurjan - (05:23): but could not succeed cjdelisle - (05:24): Where exactly was it getting the .css file from? baurjan - (05:24): just a minute cjdelisle - (05:25): I don't know the specifics about the Blog application but to find what you're looking for, when you are at the page which shows the date, You want to add ?viewer=code to that page and start following the code until you find where the date is displayed. baurjan - (05:25):

??? 01 2009

cjdelisle - (05:25): Is your problem that the date is incorrect? baurjan - (05:26): no baurjan - (05:26): i just want to change how it is displayed baurjan - (05:26): the view of the date cjdelisle - (05:27): Since the blog application is inside of the database, the css file you are looking for is inside of the database as well. baurjan - (05:27): hmm ok cjdelisle - (05:28): One fix which comes to mind is to search for all documents in the /Blog/ space which have stylesheet objects attached. baurjan - (05:29): so there is no way i can change the file that is in database cjdelisle - (05:29): Oh you can easily change it once you find it ;) cjdelisle - (05:29): And your changes will have all the benefits of the XWiki versioning system. cjdelisle - (05:30): (If you don't like them, just roll them back.) cjdelisle - (05:30): You could create a new document and put in: cjdelisle - (05:30): {{velocity}} baurjan - (05:31): what is velocity? cjdelisle - (05:31): it's a programming (scripting) language. baurjan - (05:31): i c cjdelisle - (05:32): #set($docsNames = $xwiki.searchDocuments(", BaseObject as obj where doc.fullName = obj.name and obj.className = 'XWiki.StyleSheetExtension' and doc.space='Blog'")) cjdelisle - (05:33): #foreach($name in $docsNames) cjdelisle - (05:33):   [[$name]] cjdelisle - (05:33): #end cjdelisle - (05:33): {{/velocity}} cjdelisle - (05:33): ^^ try putting that into an empty document. cjdelisle - (05:34): excluding this part: `` what is velocity? it's a programming (scripting) language. i c'' cjdelisle - (05:34): that's off the top of my head, I don't have my wiki engine running, it probably has a little mistake somewhere. baurjan - (05:35): what it is goin to give me? cjdelisle - (05:35): If it works, a list of document links to any document in the Blog space which has a css object. baurjan - (05:35): cool baurjan - (05:35): i'll try it now baurjan - (05:36): but where should i put that code? cjdelisle - (05:36): just create a new document anywhere and paste that as the content of the document. cjdelisle - (05:36): document, meaning an XWikiDocument inside of the wiki engine... baurjan - (05:37): how do i create a document, you mean a new space or page? cjdelisle - (05:37): yes, a new page. cjdelisle - (05:38): hehe internally they're called documents, I forget that the user interface calls it a page. baurjan - (05:41): ok, i opened a sandbox test1 baurjan - (05:41): opened wysiwyg baurjan - (05:41): i mean edit in wysiwyg cjdelisle - (05:41): err nope, you want wiki editor, not wysiwyg. baurjan - (05:41): and put code in it cjdelisle - (05:41): sorry for the confusion. baurjan - (05:43): but where should i put that code baurjan - (05:43): ? cjdelisle - (05:44): Edit in wiki mode then just paste it right into the page as the content. baurjan - (05:46): ok, the code returned me a ManageBlog Categories baurjan - (05:46): :) cjdelisle - (05:47): How many pages did it output? cjdelisle - (05:47): err how many links I should say. baurjan - (05:47): just one cjdelisle - (05:48): Well then I guess we know where the css you want is. baurjan - (05:48): ManageCategories baurjan - (05:48): where? cjdelisle - (05:48): Just click on that link and see if there's an edit button in the corner of the ManageCategories page. baurjan - (05:49): yup, it it there cjdelisle - (05:49): Are you set as an "advanced user" so you see the different ways to edit a page? baurjan - (05:50): yup baurjan - (05:50): superAdmin cjdelisle - (05:50): Ok, just hold the mouse over the edut button and you should see a dropdown menu. cjdelisle - (05:50): Select "Objects" in that menu. baurjan - (05:50): ok baurjan - (05:50): ok cjdelisle - (05:51): Do you see a "StyleSheetClass" object in the menu which shows up? baurjan - (05:51): yes cjdelisle - (05:52): Click on that to expand it and you should see a text area with the css you are looking for. baurjan - (05:53): ok got it, but thisi is only for managing blog categories baurjan - (05:53): i just need to find the one that is for blogs themselvs cjdelisle - (05:54): Af you do a search (ctrl+F) do you find "blogDay" in that css? cjdelisle - (05:54): I baurjan - (05:54): no baurjan - (05:54): it is a small file cjdelisle - (05:54): Hmm. venkatesh left at 05:54 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds cjdelisle - (05:56): If you do a regular find-containing on the filesystem /webapps/ folder does anything contain "blogDay"? baurjan - (05:56): let me try sdumitriu left at 05:57 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds baurjan - (06:01): couldnt find anything cjdelisle - (06:03): ok, you're sure "blogDay" was the name? baurjan - (06:04): i guess i have to find this document Blog.WebHome baurjan - (06:05): i think if i modify it i'' get what i want cjdelisle - (06:05): doing a hard disk search of the source code for css fies with blogDay. cjdelisle - (06:06): hrm mope nothing. cjdelisle - (06:06):     m baurjan - (06:06): blogDay is not a file name cjdelisle - (06:06):      n cjdelisle - (06:06): It's a class right? baurjan - (06:06): it is just a css class whish is defined in a cs file cjdelisle - (06:06): it should be inside of a file. cjdelisle - (06:07): find ./ -name 'css' -exec grep 'blogDay' {} \; -print cjdelisle - (06:07): user@debo8:~/wrk/xwiki$ find ./ -name 'xml' -exec grep 'blogDay' {} \; -print cjdelisle - (06:07): nothing. cjdelisle - (06:07): I guess it's just not defined anywhere. baurjan - (06:07): well, i am using wndows cjdelisle - (06:07): So you can define it anywhere you like. baurjan - (06:07): not a mac or linux venkatesh joined #xwiki at 06:07 cjdelisle - (06:07): Since it's java, it's the same code. cjdelisle - (06:08): So what you can do is define blogDay in any css file you like and use it. cjdelisle - (06:08): What I recommend is you add your own css extensions in a document. cjdelisle - (06:08): err page ;) cjdelisle - (06:09): So just create a page somewhere out of the way, Code.Page or something and in that page, add a StyleSheetExtension. cjdelisle - (06:09): If I recall, there's an option to make that style sheet extension be used all of the time. cjdelisle - (06:10): So with that and the !important css command you should be able to override anything you want to. baurjan left at 06:14 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds baurjan joined #xwiki at 06:40 Denis left at 07:01 (Read error: Connection reset by peer Denis joined #xwiki at 07:08 rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 07:14 mflorea joined #xwiki at 07:45 sburjan` joined #xwiki at 08:00 asrfel joined #xwiki at 08:22 vmassol joined #xwiki at 08:55 sburjan joined #xwiki at 08:57 silviar joined #xwiki at 09:05 rrodriguez left at 09:11 (Quit: rrodriguez silviar left at 09:15 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds silviar joined #xwiki at 09:19 fmancinelli joined #xwiki at 09:19 fmancinelli left at 09:21 (Client Quit evalica joined #xwiki at 09:29 sburjan - (09:36): evalica: can you tell me again what to test ? sburjan - (09:36): I don't have the logs here sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 09:39 lucaa1 joined #xwiki at 09:41 lucaa left at 09:41 (Read error: Connection reset by peer vmassol - (09:42): good morning sburjan - (09:42): good morning evalica - (09:43): (7:01:17 PM) evalica: sburjan`: can you test something? evalica - (09:43): (7:02:59 PM) evalica: when you're editing the page, you have to double save the page using the shortcut (Alt+Shift+S) in order for the change to be applied. Works ok if you press the Save buttons evalica - (09:43): for M2 vmassol - (09:43): sburjan: btw I worked on fixing clover for our build in order to get information on our TPC and know where to focus testing. It's not perfect yet though but getting there sburjan - (09:44): cool sburjan - (09:45): how come we don't use eclEmma ? vmassol - (09:45): FTM there's one problem with aspectj and clover in xwiki-core but the rest seem to work well vmassol - (09:46): sburjan: you could say the same thing of cobertura vmassol - (09:46): eclEmma is for eclipse so you probably mean Emma sburjan - (09:46): yes sburjan - (09:46): vmassol: what kind of problem ? vmassol - (09:46): if you can make it works with our build and that it provides TPC including functional tests then I'd agree vmassol - (09:47): s/works/work/ vmassol - (09:47): I need to verify if we can not weave our aspects in xwiki-core when running clover vmassol - (09:47): ideally we shouldn't use deprecated apis but I fear we still do in some places. Fixing those could be a way sburjan - (09:48): I'm almost done writing tests for annotations sburjan - (09:48): yes ... lucaa1 left at 09:48 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds sburjan - (09:48): gonna create a partch and send it to Anca for review, and if she's +1, she'll commit baurjan left at 09:49 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds rstavro joined #xwiki at 09:50 sburjan` left at 09:51 (Read error: Connection reset by peer sburjan` joined #xwiki at 09:52 rstavro - (09:52): hello all sburjan - (09:53): hello rstavro - (09:53): I have a document with an object attached, and the title of that document is like: $doc.prop1 $doc.prop2 rstavro - (09:54): in inline mode the title acts like the content, so the properties are interpreted like form fields rstavro - (09:54): this is not right rstavro - (09:55): because I would expect for the title to be the same as in view mode rstavro - (09:55): am I wrong ? rstavro - (09:58): my point is that the title should not be part of the inline form unless I choose to put it there tmortagne joined #xwiki at 09:58 vmassol - (09:59): not sure vmassol - (09:59): we do use this feature in some places vmassol - (09:59): but you can protected against it vmassol - (09:59): s/protected/protect/ vmassol - (10:00): with an #if, it's more work though rstavro - (10:00): yes, I know I can do that Enygma` joined #xwiki at 10:00 rstavro - (10:00): but I don't see why is it like this evalica1 joined #xwiki at 10:00 rstavro - (10:00): where is the logic? rstavro - (10:01): what is the logic? vmassol - (10:01): what is the logic for having form fields at all? rstavro - (10:01): he he :) vmassol - (10:01): I mean it's the same logic vmassol - (10:01): if you want to allow the user to edit the title rstavro - (10:02): yes, I agree, but display the field in inline mode as it in edit wiki mode vmassol - (10:02): we \*could\* decide not to support this feature rstavro - (10:02): not interpret the prop values vmassol - (10:02): edit wiki mode is different vmassol - (10:02): it's about editing the script vmassol - (10:02): while inlne is about editing the value vmassol - (10:02): it's user-friendly evalica left at 10:03 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds vmassol - (10:03): only thing I'm saying is that this could currently be considered a feature vmassol - (10:03): now if we think it has more drawbacks than pros we could decide not to support it anymore vmassol - (10:03): personally I don't know, haven't used that much rstavro - (10:04): I don't thik that using it in some places is a good reason of supporting it ... for example, the common use case is to use the inline form for editing properties of an object attached to a page, or its content rstavro - (10:06): I don't know either ... I'm trying to find a good reason why this could be indeed a feature rstavro - (10:06): duplicating doc properties in inline mode because of such titles ... it's a bug in my opinion rstavro - (10:07): I would prefer to edit templates and put an if for adding the title in the inline form, not the other way rstavro - (10:11): (the other way around) evalica1 left at 10:12 (Read error: Connection reset by peer cjdelisle - (10:12): http://www.eclipse.org/jgit/ <-- interesting rstavro - (10:13): it's like the situation of the properties of an object attached to a page ... why  not add all those properties to the form by default? because is useless -> there is the object editor vmassol - (10:14): otp evalica joined #xwiki at 10:15 silviar left at 10:16 (Quit: Leaving. silviar joined #xwiki at 10:22 rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 10:31 jvdrean joined #xwiki at 10:33 baurjan joined #xwiki at 10:59 baurjan - (10:59): anybody to help? cjdelisle - (11:00): you're up late, or is it early? cjdelisle - (11:01): ahh you were up late and now getting up early. baurjan - (11:01): haha baurjan - (11:01): it is 3 pm at my side cjdelisle - (11:02): 5AM here. baurjan - (11:02): wow baurjan - (11:02): so the question is baurjan - (11:02): i am trying to translate titles of the panels baurjan - (11:03): however, not all panel titles are in the property file cjdelisle - (11:03): Which one specifically? baurjan - (11:03): are all panels created by one person , or there are several people who worked on them? cjdelisle - (11:03): several baurjan - (11:03): Blog Categories vmassol - (11:04): mflorea: good morning, you might want to check if my latest change has any impact on the wysiwyg code. It compiles fine but I haven't checked if any change is required (I don't think so since I haven't changed the external behavior) mflorea - (11:04): vmassol: ok, let's see if the selenium tests pass cjdelisle - (11:06): baurjan, indeed it is not translated. you should be able to fix it by editing objects in the Blog/CategoriesPanel page. baurjan - (11:06): hmm ok baurjan - (11:13): i've looked at the code, but could not figure out what to change and where baurjan - (11:14): appearantly the title of the panel is taken from them filed of item object baurjan - (11:16): where can i edit this file: {{include document="Blog.CategoriesCode"/}} cjdelisle - (11:25): ahh sorry, read my search output wrong, try Blog/CategoriesCode cjdelisle - (11:25): heh we came to the same conclusion I guess. baurjan - (11:28): i am in Blog.Categories code baurjan - (11:28): still cant find title cjdelisle - (11:30): hmm. Maybe I was right the first time. cjdelisle - (11:30): Blog/CategoriesPanel cjdelisle - (11:31): #panelheader('Blog Categories') <-- that baurjan - (11:33): where did you find it? cjdelisle - (11:34): Should be inside of the panel object in that page. baurjan - (11:41): got it baurjan - (11:41): man, it is kinda hard thing to modify xwiki baurjan - (11:41): though, ilike it baurjan - (11:41): :) vmassol - (11:44): guys I could use some votes for the " [Proposal] Merge Link and Image as Reference in Rendering module" mail thread vmassol - (11:45): If I'm to iplement this for RC1 I have only 1.5 day left vmassol - (11:45): again this is to fix http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5554 and http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5549 vmassol - (11:45): (I've renamed the thread from Proposal to VOTE) lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:50 baurjan - (12:01): cjdelisle where are from baurjan - (12:01): ? baurjan - (12:01): i guess from US baurjan - (12:01): right? cjdelisle - (12:01): massachusetts baurjan - (12:01): cool baurjan - (12:01): I ahve graduated from Syracuse University baurjan - (12:02): I miss US cjdelisle - (12:02): Syracuse. haha they have some awesome politics over there. baurjan - (12:02): what kind of politics? cjdelisle - (12:02): Northern NY perpetual political war. baurjan - (12:03): well I didnt hear about it baurjan - (12:03): what exactly it about? cjdelisle - (12:03): All the NY political people are in it for themselves, pretty funny from over the border. baurjan - (12:04): you mean all NY politics graduated from Syracuse/ baurjan - (12:04): ? cjdelisle - (12:04): Nah, just that reminded me of northern NY. cjdelisle - (12:04): So what are ya doing in a bank in Kazakhstan? cjdelisle - (12:05): That's correct, right? baurjan - (12:05): who sayd that I am in a bank? cjdelisle - (12:05): your ip address ;) baurjan - (12:05): haha baurjan - (12:05): wow baurjan - (12:05): how did you figure out it? cjdelisle - (12:06): 193 is a strange block so I whois'd it. baurjan - (12:06): i mean how you did it? baurjan - (12:07): or you are the one who created this website baurjan - (12:07): ? cjdelisle - (12:07): just open a terminal and type whois pool-74-106-70-62.spfdma.east.verizon.net baurjan - (12:07): i am using windows baurjan - (12:08): any idei how to it on windows? baurjan - (12:08): do\* cjdelisle - (12:08): Doesn't matter but still my ip is shared within a 50 mile radius so it won't help much. baurjan - (12:08): :) baurjan - (12:08): ok cjdelisle - (12:08): Love dynamic ip ;) baurjan - (12:08): I work at the bank baurjan - (12:08): as a java developer cjdelisle - (12:08): How's that going? baurjan - (12:08): not bad baurjan - (12:10): I was offered a master degree and PHD at Syracuse baurjan - (12:10): what do you think should I agree to it? cjdelisle - (12:10): Does it mean going in to school debt? baurjan - (12:11): nope baurjan - (12:11): everything is paid by a professor cjdelisle - (12:11): I'd do it then. baurjan - (12:13): what do you do, got a job? cjdelisle - (12:13): I write some of the code for XWiki. baurjan - (12:13): so you are not a student baurjan - (12:14): right? cjdelisle - (12:14): College can only help you if you look for a job. Still you need to exercise your mind to avoid turning into a "work zombie", ya know be able to have original thoughts. baurjan - (12:14): thats right baurjan - (12:15): btw, I think I can contribute to xwiki by implementing kazakh languag for it cjdelisle - (12:15): The option for me was debt, I couldn't bring myself to promise that I'd be able to get a job and pay it. cjdelisle - (12:15): That's great, did you look at l10n.xwiki.org? baurjan - (12:15): so you did nt go to school at all? baurjan - (12:15): not yet cjdelisle - (12:15): A couple semesters, got the basics of java and c++ down. baurjan - (12:15): may be on weekends baurjan - (12:16): cool baurjan - (12:16): i think that is all a good programmer need to learn cjdelisle - (12:16): I had learned programming before so once I knew the commands I was set. baurjan - (12:16): :) baurjan - (12:16): wow baurjan - (12:16): :) baurjan - (12:16): you are a monster baurjan - (12:16): :) cjdelisle - (12:16): Don't be fooled, it was primitive code. baurjan - (12:17): well, some people at fivth grade only start to play with toys rrodriguez left at 12:17 (Quit: rrodriguez baurjan - (12:17): kiding baurjan - (12:18): anyway I am glad that you are helping me cjdelisle - (12:18): no pb vmassol - (12:24): cjdelisle: would be great if you could reply to the vote mail (you replied to the proposal one). Just say +1 and you're set! :) cjdelisle - (12:25): ok ;) vmassol - (12:25): mflorea: if I could have your agreement too I could start implementing it vmassol - (12:25): (I'm on hold right now and I don't have much time if I'm to do it in 2.5) cjdelisle - (12:26): I think in the long term everything will be referenced by a URI but I won't bother you with that. mflorea - (12:26): vmassol: sorry, let me repy vmassol - (12:26): cjdelisle: I agree except that the URI class isn't good enough vmassol - (12:26): (see my PS) cjdelisle - (12:27): Yup the only thing which has held me up is that a traditional URI = entity + action. cjdelisle - (12:27): held me up on proposing it. baurjan - (12:29): cjdelisle baurjan - (12:29): what is your name? cjdelisle - (12:29): Caleb James DeLisle cjdelisle - (12:29): I'm doing some cleaning up and I don't remember what I have to do to remove translation keys, do I just remove them from applicationResources.props? sdumitriu - (12:30): In theory, yes sdumitriu - (12:30): But it's hard to remove something sdumitriu - (12:30): Since it means that people that don't upgrade their apps/skins, just the core, will have dead keys baurjan - (12:30): i think you have to remove any reference to deleted element in props file cjdelisle - (12:31): They have been deprecated since 2.2 baurjan - (12:31): 2.4.3 is the latest one? tmortagne - (12:31): cjdelisle: in theory no you don't remove them tmortagne - (12:31): look at the end of the applicationResources.props file tmortagne - (12:31): there is a deprecation section sburjan\_ joined #xwiki at 12:32 cjdelisle - (12:32): I looked and I see a bunch of little deprecation sections. cjdelisle - (12:32): Is there a big day when all of these will be removed? sburjan left at 12:33 (Read error: Connection reset by peer tmortagne - (12:34): there is several aspect: tmortagne - (12:34): \* most of them can be removed when no active branch are using it anymore, the things is there is only one version in l10n.xwiki.org so we don't remove stable branch keys (lile it's explained in the file) tmortagne - (12:34): \* some important technical keys are kept because that could be used by old skin on something tmortagne - (12:34): s/lile/like/ cjdelisle - (12:35): These I put there and they were only used in one release. tmortagne - (12:36): WDYM ? if you want to remove keys introduce in 2.5 branch, no problem cjdelisle - (12:36): ``no active branch'' 2.2 was the only branch which used them tmortagne - (12:36): no need to deprecate anything in this case like for any API tmortagne - (12:37): (was talking about 2.5) tmortagne - (12:37): cjdelisle: so it's was aalready not used anymore in 2.3 ? Daemoen - (22:15): not much just discovered xwiki last night while trying to find an alternative for jira Daemoen - (22:15): bah, confluence Daemoen - (22:15): after looking at wikimatrix, im amazed people still buy confluence, technically xwiki has more features =D sdumitriu - (22:16): Well, XWiki is the right alternative Daemoen - (22:16): \* nods \*  i am curious about the webdav support, has it matured, most of the documentation seems a bit stale on the website Daemoen - (22:16): going back to the 1.7 build Daemoen - (22:17): and at the time, it only supported basic auth, etc sdumitriu - (22:17): Nothing changed there Daemoen - (22:17): \* nods \* sdumitriu - (22:18): There aren't many alternatives Daemoen - (22:18): now if only there was an xwiki alternative to jira that integrated with it like jira and confluence itegrate sdumitriu - (22:18): Digest is not feasible, since it requires storing the password in cleartext, which is not good practice at all sdumitriu - (22:18): Yes, I'm planning on writing one, but I lack the time at the moment sdumitriu - (22:19): It is possible to integrate XWiki and Jira somewhat Daemoen - (22:19): so youre the original developer, right ?
